intro: Ossaea multiflora, commonly known as the many-flowered ossaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Restionaceae and is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments. Its flowering period occurs during the summer months, producing white or pale pink blooms. Ossaea multiflora is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to coastal gardens.
